posts.post_content:
If the spoilers are to be trusted...  
  
Garruk thought to himself "Say. What if I could just out and summon one of the best creatures in the universe at the cost of ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol) ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) ?"  
  
And then he became Garruk, Caller of Beasts. And Progenitus.

@SAUS3: Exactly what I call it.

@Darthparallax: Usually your comments are pretty good, but copypasting the speech from the end of Great Dictator is the most pretentious thing I've seen on Gatherer. How many people you think actually read that?

I regularly play against a deck whose main purpose is to see this hit battlefield. This card has killed me exactly twice. I've beaten that deck with most the decks I own, including mill. I really doubt it's as good as it looks- it's actually most effective as a bluff.

posts.post_content:
Protection from everything means:  
  
- Prevent all damage that would be done to Progenitus.  
- Progenitus can't be enchanted, equipped, or fortified.  
- Progenitus can't be blocked.  
- Shroud
